result.execSummary:
The defendant David Jaime Rios was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: on or near Certain Places], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jefferson County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
On Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Rios to pay a fine of $300 + costs = $831, plus $283.50 drug abuse surcharge, plus $50 in drug testing fees= $1,164.50
On Count #2, the Court sentences Mr. Rios to pay costs = $443

The Court allows a payment plan.  After a discussion about Mr. Rios's ability to make payments in a different Jefferson County case, Case #14CT308, the Court orders a single payment plan that applies to both this case and Case #14CT308:   
Mr. Rios is to make $75 per month installment payments commencing on 6/30/16 and on the last day of each month thereafter until paid in full. 
The Court imposes the alternate sentences for non-payment in this case: 
--On Count #1, non-payment shall result in a 20 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.
--On Count #2, non-payment shall result in a 12 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.
The Court orders Mr. Rios to comply with DNA sample provision.


**8/3/16: Court orders JOC be amended to reflect that the $50 drug testing fees are joint and several with Co-Defendant Sosa.**

[MK] case called at 8:40am. 
Defendant David Jaime Rios in court with Attorney Karl E Huebner.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; plea of " No Contest " entered on Count #1 and Count #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts pleas, finds Mr. Rios guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Rios to pay a fine of $300 + costs = $831, plus $283.50 drug abuse surcharge, plus $50 in drug testing fees= $1,164.50
On Count #2, the Court sentences Mr. Rios to pay costs = $443

The Court allows a payment plan.  After a discussion about Mr. Rios's ability to make payments in a different Jefferson County case, Case #14CT308, the Court orders a single payment plan that applies to both this case and Case #14CT308:   
Mr. Rios is to make $75 per month installment payments commencing on 6/30/16 and on the last day of each month thereafter until paid in full. 
The Court imposes the alternate sentences for non-payment in this case: 
--On Count #1, non-payment shall result in a 20 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.
--On Count #2, non-payment shall result in a 12 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.
The Court orders Mr. Rios to comply with DNA sample provision.
recess 8:54am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 6, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Case called at 9:33 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant David Jaime Rios in court with Attorney Karl E Huebner. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived.
Court continues bond as previously set, as Counsel indicate that they do not wish to make any changes
Court reviews that Mr. Rios requested speedy trial at initial appearance and reviews trial dates with counsel; Judge Davis indicated that the timeline would begin today after entry of plea
Atty Huebner indicates that trial dates are ok as stand
Plea of "not guilty" entered

Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case
Defendant's

Reserve Judge Davis presiding for Branch IV: 
[MK] case called at 9:58am.
Defendant David Jaime Rios in court.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Right to counsel given
After Mr. Rios indicates that he will apply at the PD Office for representation, the Court adjourns the Initial Appearance.
After Mr. Rios indicates that he requests speedy trial, the Court schedules the Jury Trial within 60 days of the April 1st Adjourned Initial Appearance date, when the Court anticipates that Mr. Rios will enter a not-guilty plea.

The Court requires $500  signature bond, with conditions: 
--no acts or threats of violence
--to remain absolutely sober:  no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--to take all prescription drugs as prescribed
--no possession of drug paraphernalia
--no discussion of the case with Elizabeth S. Sosa
recess 10:02am 


NEXT:  (1) Adjourned Initial Appearance on 4/1/16 at 9:30am (2)  FSSC on 5/17/16 at 9:00am--JA please note in comments that sixty day time limits from 4/1/16 adjourned Initial Appearance anticipated not guilty plea are pending   (3) Jury Trial on 5/23/16 or 5/24/16 at 8:30am
